#!/bin/bash
count=0
while read -r line; do
    words=$(echo "$line" | tr '[:upper:]' '[:lower:]' | tr -s '[:space:]') # Remove punctuation and convert to lowercase.
    words=$(echo "$words" | tr '[:alpha:]' '[:alnum:]' | tr -s '[:blank:]') # Remove all non-letters.

    if [[ "$words" == "" ]]; then continue; fi # avoid adding an empty line to the word count.
    count=$(expr $count + $words) # add the number of words to the current count.
done < file.txt # read from file.txt one line at a time and do our processing. The done operator is used to ensure that each line is processed before moving on to the next line. If both those things matter use grep -v "^$|s/^ *$//".
